DataElement.preferredName: Cell Harvest Procedure Treatment Not Done Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Explanation for a patient enrolled in cell harvest treatment study not receiving treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cell Harvest Procedure Treatment Not Done Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Beyond normal limits; unrestrained.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The act, fact, or principle of giving advantages to some particular person, object, or course of action over others; designated as more desirable.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Done Reactive Lymphocyte Blood Product

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Done Reactive Lymphocyte Blood Product
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.: A type of white blood cell that enlarges in response to antigenic stimulation.: Any natural or synthetic composition that replicates the structure or function of a native component of blood.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
A type of white blood cell that enlarges in response to antigenic stimulation.
Any natural or synthetic composition that replicates the structure or function of a native component of blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not acquired, gained or come to the possession.: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Not acquired, gained or come to the possession.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR Cell Harvest CRF from Immunotherapy Section.
